body.p:
You undersigned petitioners would respectfully state to your Excellency that some three weeks Since -- in the latter week of January 1862 John. W. Bruner of Irvine Kentucky was on a visit to his family relations in Winchester Kentucky and whilst there was rudely insulted & assaulted by one Proctor Dills of said latter place, and after Dills had drawn a heavy weight to strike Bruner with, he Bruner drew his pistol & made Dills lay down his weight. & thereby probably saved his life, Bruner immediately went to the Police Judge & confessed judgment for violation of the town law in drawing his Pistol & a fine of $1000 was entered up against him in the Police Court of Winchester Kentucky, we beg your Excellency, under the circumstances attending the matter
to remit the fine against Bruner.

Robt. Fluty
Robt Riddell Jr
J. M. Pigg
A. A. Curtis
C. W. Friend
Ewd D Stockton

Winchester Po. Ct
$10. } Misc
Jno W. Bruner
Remission Issd Apr 24 1862
